intro: Thryallis tuberculata, commonly known as the woolly thryallis, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Its unique morphology includes tuberculate (bumpy) stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Thryallis tuberculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
